question:
Sorry if this is a really silly question, but I was re-working the maze problem from lecture, and the data definition for Position has the following:
(@htdd Position)

(define-struct pos (x y))
;; Position is (make-pos Natural Natural)
;; interp. an x, y position in the maze.
;;         0, 0 is upper left.
;;         a position is only valid for a given maze if:
;;            - (<= 0 x (sub1 <size>))
;;            - (<= 0 y (sub1 <size>))  
;;            - there is a true in the given cell
;;
(define P0 (make-pos 0 0)) ;upper left  in 4x4 maze
(define P1 (make-pos 3 0)) ;upper right  "  "   "
(define P2 (make-pos 0 3)) ;lower left   "  "   "
(define P3 (make-pos 3 3)) ;lower right  "  "   "
For the examples provided, shouldn't lower right, for example, be (make-pos 4 4)?
One of the maze examples provided is
(define M4
  (list O O O O O
        O W W W O
        O W O O O
        O W O W W
        W W O O O))
If the upper left is 0,0 wouldn't the bottom right be (make-pos 4 4)?
I'm also curious what is meant by "size" in (<= 0 x (sub1 <size>)) and
                                                                    (<= 0 y (sub1 <size>)) 
when describing what a valid position in a maze is.
Greatly appreciate any help
Edit: I just read it again and 4x4 maze seems to be the thing I missed here. Thanks to anyone who can confirm this, and sorry about this.
